title: Terminator Salvation (video game)
description: Terminator Salvation is a third-person shooter action video game released to coincide with the film of the same title. Developed by Grin and Halcyon Games, it was the final game by Grin. The game follows John Connor and other characters as they battle Skynet forces. It received mostly negative reviews.
plot_summary: Set in 2016, the story follows John Connor and his team as they navigate post-apocalyptic Los Angeles, battling Skynet machines. The game switches between characters like John Connor and Marcus Wright, depicting key events leading up to the film.
ios_version_summary: In 2018, John Connor aids Resistance fighters in Los Angeles, completing missions against Skynet. Marcus Wright also appears, eventually joining the Resistance with Kyle Reese. The game ends with John infiltrating and destroying a Skynet facility.
development: Announced in 2007, developed by Grin and Halcyon Games. Initially planned to include multiplayer, but it was removed to meet deadlines.

reception.general_reception: Received mostly negative reviews, especially for console and PC versions. Critics cited short length, repetitive gameplay, and lack of Christian Bale's voice acting.
